item.title: Re: Avatar Advice
item.content:encoded:
I like it, but I think it could be improved by altering the background a little. The cherry blossom motif is fine in my opinion, but I'm confused a little confused by the angle that's presented. I see what looks like the top of a tree. That top of the tree seems to be at a somewhat even hight with the swordsman, maybe just a little higher. The shot of the tree also seems to be fairly level (as in, not angled upward), although that may just be an illusion due to the fact that I'm only seeing a small portion of the tree. Anyway, with what I can see, it looks to me like the swordsman is falling from the tree, presumably intentionally, but if that's the case, he's not fallen very far, and he's at a somewhat odd angle for "controlled" falling. (It looks to me like he's going to fall flat on his face.) The shot of the swordsman makes me want to see this as an angled up shot, which conflicts with the shot of the tree. It seems to want to create two different angles at the same time (if that makes any sense at all).

Anyway, I like the intention, but background just doesn't seem to match the foreground quite right. I don't mean the cherry blossoms were a bad idea. (In fact, I like that.) I just think that perhaps a different shot of a cherry blossom tree would make it look a little better.

Although, what do I know? I'm not an art major; I'm not even very good at photoshop, and I've had my avatar as that default ninja picture since I started playing. Take my advice with caution because, quite frankly, I'm not entirely sure I know what I'm talking about.
